code: @Manual{,   title = {brickset: Interface with the Brickset API for Getting Data About LEGO Sets},   author = {Jason Bryer},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/jbryer/brickset, https://jbryer.github.io/brickset/}, }

what: Interface with the Brickset API for Getting Data About LEGO Sets
title: Interface with the Brickset API for Getting Data About LEGO Sets
text: Author: Jason Bryer, Ph.D. jason.bryer@cuny.eduWebsite: https://github.com/jbryer/brickset package provides functions access data LEGO sets Brickset website. package also contains data.frame LEGO sets (n = 18,455) 1970 2022. data set created using getSets function recommended use data frame reduce number API calls. See build.R script data frame created. Information variables included . brickset package can installed Github following command:

title: Interface with the Brickset API for Getting Data About LEGO Sets
text: use Brickset API, must first create Brickset account request API key. full Brickset API documentation available : https://brickset.com/article/52664/api-version-3-documentation functions require Brickset username, password, API key. can pass parameters, can set options: checkKey function verify API key valid: can check API usage getKeyUsageStats function. getSets function returns LEGO sets given year. getReviews function return reviews given set. getThemes getSubthemes returns information LEGO themes. getInstructions return table URLs building instructions.
code: options(brickset_key = 'YOUR_API_KEY',         brickset_username = 'YOUR_USERNAME',         brickset_password = 'YOUR_PASSWORD') brickset::checkKey() ## [1] TRUE brickset::getKeyUsageStats() ##              dateStamp count ## 1 2023-03-22T00:00:00Z    16 ## 2 2023-03-21T00:00:00Z     2 sets2021 <- brickset::getSets(2021) head(sets2021, n = 3) ##   setID                     name year theme   themeGroup ## 1 31026           Police Station 2021 Icons Model making ## 2 31754 Volkswagen T2 Camper Van 2021 Icons Model making ## 3 31025           Flower Bouquet 2021 Icons Model making ##                       subtheme category released pieces minifigs ## 1 Modular Buildings Collection   Normal     TRUE   2923        5 ## 2                     Vehicles   Normal     TRUE   2207       NA ## 3         Botanical Collection   Normal     TRUE    756       NA ##                         bricksetURL rating reviewCount packagingType ## 1 https://brickset.com/sets/10278-1    4.4           4           Box ## 2 https://brickset.com/sets/10279-1    4.1           0           Box ## 3 https://brickset.com/sets/10280-1    4.3           3           Box ##     availability agerange_min US_retailPrice US_dateFirstAvailable ## 1 LEGO exclusive           18         199.99  2021-01-02T00:00:00Z ## 2 LEGO exclusive           18         179.99  2021-08-02T00:00:00Z ## 3         Retail           18          59.99  2021-01-02T00:00:00Z ##   US_dateLastAvailable UK_retailPrice UK_dateFirstAvailable ## 1                 <NA>         169.99  2021-01-01T00:00:00Z ## 2 2022-11-12T00:00:00Z         139.99  2021-08-01T00:00:00Z ## 3                 <NA>          54.99  2021-01-01T00:00:00Z ##   UK_dateLastAvailable CA_retailPrice CA_dateFirstAvailable ## 1                 <NA>         269.99  2021-01-02T00:00:00Z ## 2 2022-11-29T00:00:00Z         249.99  2021-08-03T00:00:00Z ## 3                 <NA>          79.99  2021-01-02T00:00:00Z ##   CA_dateLastAvailable DE_retailPrice DE_dateFirstAvailable ## 1 2023-03-08T00:00:00Z         199.99  2021-01-02T00:00:00Z ## 2 2022-11-12T00:00:00Z         159.99  2021-08-02T00:00:00Z ## 3 2023-03-08T00:00:00Z          59.99  2021-01-02T00:00:00Z ##   DE_dateLastAvailable height width depth weight ## 1                 <NA>   47.6  57.7  11.8  4.012 ## 2 2022-11-30T00:00:00Z   37.4  57.8  11.2  2.945 ## 3                 <NA>   38.2  26.2   7.1  0.760 ##                                         thumbnailURL ## 1 https://images.brickset.com/sets/small/10278-1.jpg ## 2 https://images.brickset.com/sets/small/10279-1.jpg ## 3 https://images.brickset.com/sets/small/10280-1.jpg ##                                              imageURL ## 1 https://images.brickset.com/sets/images/10278-1.jpg ## 2 https://images.brickset.com/sets/images/10279-1.jpg ## 3 https://images.brickset.com/sets/images/10280-1.jpg reviews29830 <- brickset::getReviews(29830) names(reviews29830) ##  [1] "author"             "datePosted"         "title"              ##  [4] "review"             "HTML"               "overall"            ##  [7] "parts"              "buildingExperience" "playability"        ## [10] "valueForMoney" getThemes() |> head(n = 3) ##             theme setCount subthemeCount yearFrom yearTo ## 1       4 Juniors       24             5     2003   2004 ## 2 Action Wheelers        9             0     2000   2001 ## 3 Advanced models       35            12     2000   2012 getSubthemes('Toy Story') ##       theme          subtheme setCount yearFrom yearTo ## 1 Toy Story Buildable Figures        2     2010   2010 ## 2 Toy Story     Original Film        2     2010   2010 ## 3 Toy Story       Toy Story 2        3     2010   2010 ## 4 Toy Story       Toy Story 3        8     2010   2010 getYears('Toy Story') ##       theme year setCount ## 1 Toy Story 2010       15 instructions <- getInstructions(setID = 29830) instructions ##                                                                       URL ## 1 https://www.lego.com/cdn/product-assets/product.bi.core.pdf/6313846.pdf ## 2 https://www.lego.com/cdn/product-assets/product.bi.core.pdf/6313848.pdf ## 3 https://www.lego.com/cdn/product-assets/product.bi.core.pdf/6313849.pdf ## 4 https://www.lego.com/cdn/product-assets/product.bi.core.pdf/6313850.pdf ##                             description ## 1 BI 3103, 112+4/65+200G, 10270 V29 1/2 ## 2   BI 3103, 96+4/65+200G,10270 V29 2/2 ## 3   BI 3103, 112+4/65+200G, V39/142 1/2 ## 4    BI 3103, 96+4/65+200G, V39/142 2/2

title: Interface with the Brickset API for Getting Data About LEGO Sets
text: legosets data frame contains LEGO sets (n = 18,455) 1970 2022.   variables legosets data frame :
code: data("legosets", package = "brickset") ggplot(legosets, aes(x = year)) + geom_bar() +     ggtitle('Number of LEGO sets by year') +     xlab('Year') + ylab('Number of LEGO Sets') ggplot(legosets, aes(x = pieces, y = US_retailPrice)) +      geom_point() +     ggtitle('Cost of LEGO sets by number of pieces') +     xlab('Number of LEGO pieces') + ylab('US Retail Price (dollars)')

code: if (FALSE) { options(brickset_key = 'BRICKSET_KEY',         brickset_username = 'BRICKSET_UERNAME',         brickset_password = 'BRICKSET_PASSWORD') checkKey() # Will return TRUE if the credentials are correct }
